speaker: JAQUES
text: I prithee, pretty youth, let me be better

speaker: JAQUES
text: acquainted with thee.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: They say you are a melancholy

speaker: ROSALIND
text: fellow.

speaker: JAQUES
text: I am so. I do love it better than laughing.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Those that are in extremity

speaker: ROSALIND
text: of either are abominable fellows and betray

speaker: ROSALIND
text: themselves to every modern censure worse than

speaker: ROSALIND
text: drunkards.

speaker: JAQUES
text: Why, ’tis good to be sad and say nothing.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Why then, ’tis good to be a

speaker: ROSALIND
text: post.

speaker: JAQUES
text: I have neither the scholar’s melancholy, which

speaker: JAQUES
text: is emulation; nor the musician’s, which is fantastical;

speaker: JAQUES
text: nor the courtier’s, which is proud; nor the

speaker: JAQUES
text: soldier’s, which is ambitious; nor the lawyer’s,

speaker: JAQUES
text: which is politic; nor the lady’s, which is nice; nor

speaker: JAQUES
text: the lover’s, which is all these; but it is a melancholy

speaker: JAQUES
text: of mine own, compounded of many simples, extracted

speaker: JAQUES
text: from many objects, and indeed the sundry

speaker: JAQUES
text: contemplation of my travels, in which my often

speaker: JAQUES
text: rumination wraps me in a most humorous sadness.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: A traveller. By my faith, you

speaker: ROSALIND
text: have great reason to be sad. I fear you have sold

speaker: ROSALIND
text: your own lands to see other men’s. Then to have

speaker: ROSALIND
text: seen much and to have nothing is to have rich eyes

speaker: ROSALIND
text: and poor hands.

speaker: JAQUES
text: Yes, I have gained my experience.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: And your experience makes

speaker: ROSALIND
text: you sad. I had rather have a fool to make me merry

speaker: ROSALIND
text: than experience to make me sad—and to travel for

speaker: ROSALIND
text: it too.

speaker: ORLANDO
text:
Good
               
              day
               
              and
               
              happiness
              ,
               
              dear
               
              Rosalind
              .

speaker: JAQUES
text: Nay then, God be wi’ you, an you talk in blank

speaker: JAQUES
text: verse.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Farewell, Monsieur Traveller.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Look you lisp and wear strange suits, disable all

speaker: ROSALIND
text: the benefits of your own country, be out of love with

speaker: ROSALIND
text: your nativity, and almost chide God for making you

speaker: ROSALIND
text: that countenance you are, or I will scarce think you

speaker: ROSALIND
text: have swam in a gondola.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Why, how now, Orlando, where have you been all

speaker: ROSALIND
text: this while? You a lover? An you serve me such

speaker: ROSALIND
text: another trick, never come in my sight more.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: My fair Rosalind, I come within an hour of

speaker: ORLANDO
text: my promise.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Break an hour’s promise in

speaker: ROSALIND
text: love? He that will divide a minute into a thousand

speaker: ROSALIND
text: parts and break but a part of the thousand part of a

speaker: ROSALIND
text: minute in the affairs of love, it may be said of him

speaker: ROSALIND
text: that Cupid hath clapped him o’ th’ shoulder, but I’ll

speaker: ROSALIND
text: warrant him heart-whole.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Pardon me, dear Rosalind.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Nay, an you be so tardy,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: come no more in my sight. I had as lief be wooed of

speaker: ROSALIND
text: a snail.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Of a snail?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Ay, of a snail, for though he

speaker: ROSALIND
text: comes slowly, he carries his house on his head—a

speaker: ROSALIND
text: better jointure, I think, than you make a woman.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Besides, he brings his destiny with him.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: What’s that?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Why, horns, which such as

speaker: ROSALIND
text: you are fain to be beholding to your wives for. But

speaker: ROSALIND
text: he comes armed in his fortune and prevents the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: slander of his wife.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Virtue is no hornmaker, and my Rosalind is

speaker: ORLANDO
text: virtuous.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: And I am your Rosalind.

speaker: CELIA
text: It pleases him to call you so, but he

speaker: CELIA
text: hath a Rosalind of a better leer than you.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Come, woo me,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: woo me, for now I am in a holiday humor, and like

speaker: ROSALIND
text: enough to consent. What would you say to me now

speaker: ROSALIND
text: an I were your very, very Rosalind?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I would kiss before I spoke.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Nay, you were better speak

speaker: ROSALIND
text: first, and when you were gravelled for lack of

speaker: ROSALIND
text: matter, you might take occasion to kiss. Very good

speaker: ROSALIND
text: orators, when they are out, they will spit; and for

speaker: ROSALIND
text: lovers lacking—God warn us—matter, the cleanliest

speaker: ROSALIND
text: shift is to kiss.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: How if the kiss be denied?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Then she puts you to entreaty,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: and there begins new matter.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Who could be out, being before his beloved

speaker: ORLANDO
text: mistress?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Marry, that should you if I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: were your mistress, or I should think my honesty

speaker: ROSALIND
text: ranker than my wit.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: What, of my suit?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Not out of your apparel, and

speaker: ROSALIND
text: yet out of your suit. Am not I your Rosalind?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I take some joy to say you are because I

speaker: ORLANDO
text: would be talking of her.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Well, in her person I say I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: will not have you.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Then, in mine own person I die.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: No, faith, die by attorney.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: The poor world is almost six thousand years old,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: and in all this time there was not any man died in

speaker: ROSALIND
text: his own person, videlicet, in a love cause. Troilus

speaker: ROSALIND
text: had his brains dashed out with a Grecian club, yet

speaker: ROSALIND
text: he did what he could to die before, and he is one of

speaker: ROSALIND
text: the patterns of love. Leander, he would have lived

speaker: ROSALIND
text: many a fair year though Hero had turned nun, if it

speaker: ROSALIND
text: had not been for a hot midsummer night, for, good

speaker: ROSALIND
text: youth, he went but forth to wash him in the Hellespont

speaker: ROSALIND
text: and, being taken with the cramp, was

speaker: ROSALIND
text: drowned; and the foolish chroniclers of that age

speaker: ROSALIND
text: found it was Hero of Sestos. But these are all lies.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Men have died from time to time and worms have

speaker: ROSALIND
text: eaten them, but not for love.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I would not have my right Rosalind of this

speaker: ORLANDO
text: mind, for I protest her frown might kill me.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: By this hand, it will not kill a

speaker: ROSALIND
text: fly. But come; now I will be your Rosalind in a more

speaker: ROSALIND
text: coming-on disposition, and ask me what you will, I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: will grant it.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Then love me, Rosalind.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Yes, faith, will I, Fridays and

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Saturdays and all.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: And wilt thou have me?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Ay, and twenty such.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: What sayest thou?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Are you not good?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I hope so.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Why then, can one desire

speaker: ROSALIND
text: too much of a good thing?—Come, sister, you shall

speaker: ROSALIND
text: be the priest and marry us.—Give me your hand,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Orlando.—What do you say, sister?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Pray thee marry us.

speaker: CELIA
text: I cannot say the words.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: You must begin “Will you,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Orlando—”

speaker: CELIA
text: Go to.—Will you, Orlando, have to

speaker: CELIA
text: wife this Rosalind?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I will.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Ay, but when?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Why now, as fast as she can marry us.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Then you must say “I take

speaker: ROSALIND
text: thee, Rosalind, for wife.”

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I take thee, Rosalind, for wife.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: I might ask you for your

speaker: ROSALIND
text: commission, but I do take thee, Orlando, for my

speaker: ROSALIND
text: husband. There’s a girl goes before the priest, and

speaker: ROSALIND
text: certainly a woman’s thought runs before her

speaker: ROSALIND
text: actions.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: So do all thoughts. They are winged.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Now tell me how long you

speaker: ROSALIND
text: would have her after you have possessed her?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Forever and a day.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Say “a day” without the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: “ever.” No, no, Orlando, men are April when they

speaker: ROSALIND
text: woo, December when they wed. Maids are May

speaker: ROSALIND
text: when they are maids, but the sky changes when

speaker: ROSALIND
text: they are wives. I will be more jealous of thee than a

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Barbary cock-pigeon over his hen, more clamorous

speaker: ROSALIND
text: than a parrot against rain, more newfangled than

speaker: ROSALIND
text: an ape, more giddy in my desires than a monkey. I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: will weep for nothing, like Diana in the fountain,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: and I will do that when you are disposed to be

speaker: ROSALIND
text: merry. I will laugh like a hyena, and that when thou

speaker: ROSALIND
text: art inclined to sleep.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: But will my Rosalind do so?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: By my life, she will do as I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: do.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: O, but she is wise.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Or else she could not have

speaker: ROSALIND
text: the wit to do this. The wiser, the waywarder. Make

speaker: ROSALIND
text: the doors upon a woman’s wit, and it will out at the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: casement. Shut that, and ’twill out at the keyhole.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Stop that, ’twill fly with the smoke out at the

speaker: ROSALIND
text: chimney.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: A man that had a wife with such a wit, he

speaker: ORLANDO
text: might say “Wit, whither wilt?”

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Nay, you might keep that

speaker: ROSALIND
text: check for it till you met your wife’s wit going to

speaker: ROSALIND
text: your neighbor’s bed.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: And what wit could wit have to excuse that?

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Marry, to say she came to

speaker: ROSALIND
text: seek you there. You shall never take her without her

speaker: ROSALIND
text: answer unless you take her without her tongue. O,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: that woman that cannot make her fault her husband’s

speaker: ROSALIND
text: occasion, let her never nurse her child

speaker: ROSALIND
text: herself, for she will breed it like a fool.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: For these two hours, Rosalind, I will leave

speaker: ORLANDO
text: thee.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Alas, dear love, I cannot lack

speaker: ROSALIND
text: thee two hours.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: I must attend the Duke at dinner. By two

speaker: ORLANDO
text: o’clock I will be with thee again.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Ay, go your ways, go your

speaker: ROSALIND
text: ways. I knew what you would prove. My friends told

speaker: ROSALIND
text: me as much, and I thought no less. That flattering

speaker: ROSALIND
text: tongue of yours won me. ’Tis but one cast away, and

speaker: ROSALIND
text: so, come, death. Two o’clock is your hour?

speaker: ORLANDO
text: Ay, sweet Rosalind.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: By my troth, and in good

speaker: ROSALIND
text: earnest, and so God mend me, and by all pretty

speaker: ROSALIND
text: oaths that are not dangerous, if you break one jot of

speaker: ROSALIND
text: your promise or come one minute behind your

speaker: ROSALIND
text: hour, I will think you the most pathetical break-promise,

speaker: ROSALIND
text: and the most hollow lover, and the most

speaker: ROSALIND
text: unworthy of her you call Rosalind that may be

speaker: ROSALIND
text: chosen out of the gross band of the unfaithful.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Therefore beware my censure, and keep your

speaker: ROSALIND
text: promise.

speaker: ORLANDO
text: With no less religion than if thou wert indeed

speaker: ORLANDO
text: my Rosalind. So, adieu.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Well, time is the old justice

speaker: ROSALIND
text: that examines all such offenders, and let time try.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: Adieu.

speaker: CELIA
text: You have simply misused our sex in your love-prate.

speaker: CELIA
text: We must have your doublet and hose plucked

speaker: CELIA
text: over your head and show the world what the bird

speaker: CELIA
text: hath done to her own nest.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: O coz, coz, coz, my pretty little coz, that thou

speaker: ROSALIND
text: didst know how many fathom deep I am in love. But

speaker: ROSALIND
text: it cannot be sounded; my affection hath an

speaker: ROSALIND
text: unknown bottom, like the Bay of Portugal.

speaker: CELIA
text: Or rather bottomless, that as fast as you pour

speaker: CELIA
text: affection in, it runs out.

speaker: ROSALIND
text: No, that same wicked bastard of Venus, that

speaker: ROSALIND
text: was begot of thought, conceived of spleen, and born

speaker: ROSALIND
text: of madness, that blind rascally boy that abuses

speaker: ROSALIND
text: everyone’s eyes because his own are out, let him be

speaker: ROSALIND
text: judge how deep I am in love. I’ll tell thee, Aliena, I

speaker: ROSALIND
text: cannot be out of the sight of Orlando. I’ll go find a

speaker: ROSALIND
text: shadow and sigh till he come.

speaker: CELIA
text: And I’ll sleep.
